alert.note: Alert for Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:20PM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tioughnioga River at Cortland. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Flooding leads to some closures along Kellogg Road to the south of Cortland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 PM EST Monday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.3 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1030 AM EST.
